poem:
**Water Rising**

In the quiet hollow of pockets,  
a ripple—economics wades  
deep, deeper still into streams  
of thought. Thirst, unquenched,  
runs its course; a dammed river  
speaks to silence, while taps  
lament their heavy burden,  
each drop a measured sigh  
against an unyielding stone.
